newsitem.title: DEMOCRATIC REPUBLIC OF CONGO: New Congo diamonds sold to Susskind, not De Beers.
newsitem.headline: New Congo diamonds sold to Susskind, not De Beers.

text.p: The Democratic Republic of the Congo has sold diamonds from the MIBA mine in Mbuji-Mayi to Antwerp-based Susskind, the first time in many years it has dealt with a firm other than South African giant De Beers Consolidated Mines Ltd.
Maurice Nabahola, an adviser to the minister of mines, told Reuters on Wednesday that Susskind had outbid De Beers and International Diamond Company at an auction last week.

"The June production (of diamonds) went to the highest bidder. The sale by auction is synonymous with competition. Susskind Diamonds put up much more money than the rest of the competitors. We had to accept the best offer," Nabahola said.
